subject: Programming
title: Go and Simplicity
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Go and Simplicity.

hook.text: Google engineers spent hours waiting for C++ code to compile. They wanted something faster.

buildup.text: Rob Pike, Ken Thompson, and Robert Griesemer designed Go in 2009 with radical simplicity.

discovery.text: Go compiled in seconds, handled thousands of concurrent tasks, and had just 25 keywords.

twist.text: Programmers complained Go lacked features and felt too basic. Google said that was the point.

climax.text: Docker, Kubernetes, and most cloud infrastructure now run on Go.

punchline.text: Simplicity became the cloud's secret weapon.

quiz.question: Which major infrastructure tools were built with Go?
